required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of Moxifloxacin in Vigadexa速 in Aqueous Humor Samples Following Preoperative Antibiotic/Steroid Dosing in Cataract Surgery Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of Moxifloxacin in Vigadexa速 in Aqueous Humor Samples Following Preoperative Antibiotic/Steroid Dosing in Cataract Surgery Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine the moxifloxacin aqueous penetration when dosing with a combination drug Vigadexa preoperatively in cataract patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Aqueous Humor Concentration of Moxifloxacin
primary_outcome.description: A 0.150 milliliter sample of the aqueous humor was obtained during cataract surgery. The concentration of moxifloxacin was measured by a validated procedure using high performance liquid-spectrometry.

arm_group.description: Moxifloxacin 0.5%/Dexamethasone 0.1% ophthalmic solution, 1 drop instilled in the study eye 2 days before surgery, followed by 1 drop instilled 4 times a day the day before surgery. On the day of surgery, 1 drop was instilled 60 minutes prior to the procedure.

overall_official.last_name: Mauro Silveira de Queiroz Campos, MD
overall_official.affiliation: Federal University of S達o Paulo, Ophthalmology Service

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from one study center in Brazil.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This reporting group includes all enrolled subjects.

group.title: VIGADEXA
group.description: Moxifloxacin 0.5%/Dexamethasone 0.1% ophthalmic solution, 1 drop instilled in the study eye 2 days before surgery, followed by 1 drop instilled 4 times a day the day before surgery. On the day of surgery, 1 drop was instilled 60 minutes prior to the procedure.

baseline.population: This reporting group includes all enrolled subjects who received all doses of the test product.

group.title: VIGADEXA
group.description: Moxifloxacin 0.5%/Dexamethasone 0.1% ophthalmic solution, 1 drop instilled in the study eye 2 days before surgery, followed by 1 drop instilled 4 times a day the day before surgery. On the day of surgery, 1 drop was instilled 60 minutes prior to the procedure.

outcome.title: Mean Aqueous Humor Concentration of Moxifloxacin
outcome.description: A 0.150 milliliter sample of the aqueous humor was obtained during cataract surgery. The concentration of moxifloxacin was measured by a validated procedure using high performance liquid-spectrometry.
outcome.population: Per protocol: All subjects who met inclusion/exclusion criteria, received all doses of the test product, and underwent cataract surgery with aqueous humor sampling.

group.title: VIGADEXA
group.description: Moxifloxacin 0.5%/Dexamethasone 0.1% ophthalmic solution, 1 drop instilled in the study eye 2 days before surgery, followed by 1 drop instilled 4 times a day the day before surgery. On the day of surgery, 1 drop was instilled 60 minutes prior to the procedure.

measure.title: Mean Aqueous Humor Concentration of Moxifloxacin
measure.description: A 0.150 milliliter sample of the aqueous humor was obtained during cataract surgery. The concentration of moxifloxacin was measured by a validated procedure using high performance liquid-spectrometry.
measure.population: Per protocol: All subjects who met inclusion/exclusion criteria, received all doses of the test product, and underwent cataract surgery with aqueous humor sampling.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of the study. An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, or deterioration of a pre-existing medical condition, that occurred during or after test product administration.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were obtained as solicited comments from the study subjects and as observations by the study Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.

group.title: VIGADEXA
group.description: Moxifloxacin 0.5%/Dexamethasone 0.1% ophthalmic solution, 1 drop instilled in the study eye 2 days before surgery, followed by 1 drop instilled 4 times a day the day before surgery. On the day of surgery, 1 drop was instilled 60 minutes prior to the procedure.
